Deepak Kapa

Robotics Engineer & Researcher

BTech Engineering Physics

IIT Roorkee, India

Graduating May 2026

Iâ€™m a May 2026 graduate from IIT Roorkee with a passion for designing robots, currently working as a Robotics Engineer (Mechanical) at Cenizas Labs, Chennai.

My research focuses on legged robotics, actuator design, and mechanical optimization for robotic systems. Iâ€™ve worked on developing novel planetary actuator configurations, energy-efficient quadruped mechanisms, and soft origami-based robots for real-world applications.

Research Interests

  • Actuator Design: Quasi-direct drive (QDD) actuators, planetary gearboxes, and compact high-torque density systems
  • Legged Robotics: Quadruped locomotion, energy-efficient gait optimization, and novel leg architectures
  • Co-Design Optimization: Simultaneous optimization of mechanical design and control for improved robot performance
  • Soft Robotics: Origami-inspired compliant mechanisms for adaptive behaviors

Current Work

At Cenizas Labs, Iâ€™m designing workspace-assistive robots including:

  • A differential-drive office bot with multiple actuated shelves
  • An 8-DOF carbon fiber robotic arm with 3D-printed cycloidal drives (800mm reach, 1.8kg payload)

Iâ€™m also collaborating with research groups at:

  • Indian Institute of Science (Prof. Shishir Kolathaya) - Optimal gearbox design for QDD actuators
  • University of Notre Dame (Prof. Mark Plecnik) - Asymmetric 5-bar quadruped mechanisms
  • EPFL (Remote) - Soft origami-based pipe inspection robots

selected publications

  1. Pancake 3K Planetary Actuator: A Lightweight, Compact, and Low-Backlash Actuator
    Deepak Kapa, Aman Singh, and Shishir N.Y. Kolathaya
    In IEEE-RAS 24th International Conference on Humanoid Robots (LBR), 2025
    Abs

    We propose a novel configuration for Wolfrom and compound planetary actuators that reduces the mass and axial width of the second stage by nearly 50% while maintaining the same load capacity and efficiency. The design has been validated through steady-state torque analysis and kinematic modeling, and is currently being fabricated for experimental characterization.

  2. A Co-Design Framework for Energy-Aware Monoped Jumping with Detailed Actuator Modeling
    Aman Singh, Aasta Mishra, Deepak Kapa, and 2 more authors
    In IEEE-RAS 24th International Conference on Humanoid Robots, 2025
    Abs

    We developed a detailed actuator and link mass model integrated with MuJoCo to build a three-stage co-design optimization framework for a monoped robot using CMA-ES genetic algorithms. Achieved a 50% reduction in mechanical energy for a 0.8 m jump, demonstrating the value of simulation-driven mechanical optimization in improving locomotion efficiency.

  3. COMPAct: Computational Optimization and Automated Modular Design of Planetary Actuators
    Deepak Kapa, Aman Singh, Suryank Joshi, and 1 more author
    Under Review - IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), 2026
    Under Review
    Abs

    An automated actuator and gearbox design framework in SolidWorks using Python, incorporating efficiency and gear-strength analytics to optimize actuator selection for desired torque-velocity requirements. The framework enables rapid prototyping and validation of optimal actuator configurations.

  4. A Novel Energy Efficient Quadruped with Direct-Drive Five-Bar Leg Architecture
    Deepak Kapa, Aman Singh, Shashank Ramesh, and 2 more authors
    Under Review - IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA), 2026
    Under Review
    Abs

    We designed and simulated an asymmetric 5-bar quadruped mechanism aimed at improving power efficiency during locomotion. Developed a detailed CAD model of an 8-DOF quadruped and performed dynamic gait simulations in MuJoCo under position control to evaluate motor power consumption and total cost of transport against traditional 2R configurations.

Feel free to reach out via email for research collaborations or robotics projects.
